Final Internship Funding Allocation Letter -
The INSETA is pleased to confirm that you have been allocated Discretionary Grants as
follows against the internships outlined below according to the number of the internships Agreements
and other required documents submitted in line with the recommendation letter.
IWGA-Number Start& End Date No. of Interns Amount

In order to retain this funding you will be required to comply with the following terms and conditions: 1. Acknowledge to have read and understood the guidelines for Internships programme
2. Read and understand the Discretionary grant, monitoring and Evaluation policy and guidelines
3. Accommodate any site visit from any INSETA official as per the Discretionary Grant Monitoring and Evaluation Policy and Guidelines
4. Ensure that you receive approval from INSETA for any changes/deviations from the approved application
In addition, you will be required to submit the following to the Learning Division. Failure to submit to the Learning Division at the agreed
time will result in the cancellation of the Learnership
5. This letter must be signed by the authorised signatory and returned to INSETA within 10 working days of receipt
6. Invoice in accordance with the Internship guidelines and submit 1st Tranche invoice upon request
7. Submit progress reports and payslips at midpoint of the programme
8. Submit closure report and payslips 14 days after closure of the programme
9. Submit all invoices in accordance with guideline
10. Termination reports to be submitted within 14 days of intern termination from the programme
11. Note that all administration and invoices must be submitted to INSETA by 31 July 2023, failing which all funds
not utilised for the purposes allocated will revert to INSETA automatically, without further notification.
GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS:
1. This funding commitment terminates upon discharge by INSETA and the Employer, of the obligations contained in this document.
2. Any termination of interns within the period of this funding agreement will result in the automatic adjustment of the funding value
3. INSETA may terminate this commitment at any time in part or in full without
prejudice to any rights to which it is entitled in terms of the law or by virtue of this
Agreement if the Employer:
Deviates substantially from the aims and objectives of the programme without consulting INSETA and obtaining approval;
Fails to meet any of its obligations arising from relevant legislation and those appearing in the Internship Agreement.
Breaches any terms of this agreement and those appearing in the Internship Agreement and fails to rectify the breach within 14 days of receipt of the INSETAâ€™s written notice.
4. In the case of breach or termination of this contract, INSETA may, without further notice to the Employer:
discontinue any further payment;
relocate the Intern(s) to another employer;
reclaim in full or in part any amount already paid;
charge compound interest as prescribed in the Prescribed Rate of Interest Act,
1975 (Act No. 55 of 1975), calculated from the date of cancellation or final
date of performance of this Agreement and may recover from the Employer, any
legal costs incurred by INSETA, including collection commission on an attorney
and client scale.
Decline any further funding applications from the employer.
5. In the event that any of the parties to this agreement is unable to perform any
of their respective obligations in terms of this agreement, and such non-performance
results from occurrences beyond the reasonable control of the parties concerned,
such failure shall not constitute a breach of this contract.
